title: LG X power2 with 5.5-inch display, Android Nougat and 4,500mAh battery unveiled
text:
LG X power2 with 5.5-inch display, Android Nougat and 4,500mAh battery unveiled LG X power2 with 5.5-inch display, Android Nougat and 4,500mAh battery unveiled By February 24, 2017 “The X power2’s beefy 4,500mAh battery can be charged in just two hours” 
LG appears to be on a launch spree this year. The company recently launched the LG X300 and X400 budget smartphones. Now the brand has added yet another X series smartphone to its portfolio with the launch of the LG X power2. It comes as a successor to the last year’s battery-centric LG X Power smartphone. 
Just like its predecessor, the LG X power2 also features a beefy 4,500mAh battery, which is rated to deliver up to 15 hours of video playback, 18 hours of web surfing or 14 hours of navigation. The phone also supports fast charging, which allows its battery to charge 50 percent in an hour and 100 percent in two hours. The mid-range offering boots Android 7.0 Nougat out of the box, and features enhanced UX for selfies. 
As for the other specs, the LG X power2 features a 5.5-inch HD In-Cell display, and is powered by a 1.5GHz octa-core processor of unknown make. It comes with 2GB or 1.5GB of RAM, depending on the market, and 16GB of expandable storage. The camera department includes a 13MP rear snapper and a 5MP front shooter, both accompanied by an LED flash. Connectivity-wise, the phone offers 4G LTE, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 4.2 and USB OTG. 
The LG X power2 is being offered in four hues – Black Titan, Shiny Titan, Shiny Gold and Shiny Blue. The phone will go on sale begging in March in Latin America, followed by a launch in Asian markets and other regions later. There’s no word on its pricing at the moment. Facebook Comments
